alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Bell. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Middlesboro, Ferndale, Meldrum, Ponza, East Pineville, Hutch, Clear Creek Springs, Calvin, Binghamtown, Wasioto, Wallsend, Straight Creek, Varilla and Noetown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
